summary: This is an email chain from June 27, 2019, discussing the ownership history of Jeffrey Epstein's New York mansion at 9 East 71st Street. The emails reveal questions from AUSAs about whether the property was actually owned by Leslie Wexner or by Epstein through corporate entities, and include a forwarded deed showing Epstein transferring the property to a Virgin Islands entity in 2011.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the president of 'Nine East 71st Street Corporation' and the individual who signed as both grantor and grantee on the 2011 deed transferring the property to Maple Inc. He is the central subject of the property ownership inquiry.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Publicly reported to have bought the mansion in 1989, remodeled it, and featured it in Architectural Digest in 1995. The email questions whether he truly owned it or if Epstein owned it through a corporation.

connections.description: Potential financial/property relationship centered on the ownership of 9 East 71st Street, with questions about whether Wexner owned the property or if Epstein controlled it through a corporation for which he was president.

events.title: Property purchase by Nine East 71st Street Corporation
events.description: The mansion at 9 East 71st Street was purchased by 'Nine East 71st Street Corporation.' Public reports attributed this purchase to Leslie Wexner.

events.title: Architectural Digest feature
events.description: The mansion was featured in Architectural Digest as Leslie Wexner's house.

events.title: Epstein claims ownership to NY Times
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein told the New York Times that the house at 9 East 71st Street was his.

events.title: Deed transfer to Maple Inc
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, signing for both the grantor and grantee, transferred the title of 9 East 71st Street to Maple Inc, an entity located in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands. No associated mortgages were found in online records.

keyFacts: The ownership history of Epstein's New York mansion is unclear: public reports said Leslie Wexner bought it in 1989, but the 1989 deed shows it was purchased by 'Nine East 71st Street Corporation.'
Jeffrey Epstein was the president of 'Nine East 71st Street Corporation' and in 2011, as both grantor and grantee, transferred the property title to Maple Inc, a Virgin Islands entity.

The email chain indicates active investigation by AUSAs into the true ownership and financial arrangements surrounding the property, questioning whether Epstein owned it through corporate entities the entire time rather than Wexner.
The 2011 deed shows no mortgages from the grantee, Maple Inc, were indicated in online records.
